summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from July 14, 2020, summarizing major news stories. The leading news item details federal prosecutors releasing information about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest in New Hampshire, her attempt to evade FBI agents, and the discovery of a cell phone wrapped in tinfoil. The briefing also covers a wide range of other national and international news, including protests, counter-terrorism, criminal investigations, and political developments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Alleged co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein, arrested defendant
persons.context: The document details her arrest in New Hampshire, her attempt to flee from FBI agents, and prosecutors' arguments to keep her detained as a flight risk due to her wealth and foreign connections.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Convicted sex offender, accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Referred to as the financier and convicted sex offender with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and abuse minors.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items, including criticizing Democrats on crime, retweeting criticism of the CDC, commenting on the Washington NFL team name change, and commuting Roger Stone's sentence.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Discussed in the context of a reported rift with the White House over the coronavirus response, with Trump claiming a 'very good' relationship despite criticism from administration officials.

persons.name: Roger Stone
persons.context: Discussed regarding President Trump's commutation of his prison sentence; Stone claimed Mueller prosecutors offered him leniency for information on Trump.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election and the prosecution of Roger Stone.

persons.name: Andrew Weissmann
persons.context: Noted as publishing a book about the Mueller investigation and criticized by Roger Stone.

persons.name: Kayleigh McEnany
persons.context: Spoke in defense of Trump's commutation of Roger Stone's sentence, criticized Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's comments on crime, and commented on the Washington NFL team name change.

persons.name: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
persons.context: Criticized by White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany for linking poverty to violent crime in New York City.

persons.name: Betsy DeVos
persons.context: Mentioned for pushing to reopen schools in the fall, drawing criticism from some lawmakers and educators.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: President Trump did not rule out granting a pardon to Flynn, who was seeking to have his conviction dismissed.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.role: Vice President of the United States
persons.context: Scheduled to visit Louisiana to discuss coronavirus response with state officials.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Issued a statement rejecting most of China's maritime claims in the South China Sea.

persons.name: Robert O'Brien
persons.context: Mentioned as meeting with European counterparts on Huawei and stating the U.S. was considering asylum for Hong Kong residents.

persons.name: Vauhxx Booker
persons.role: Civil rights activist, alleged assault victim
persons.context: A Black man who reported being assaulted and threatened with a noose at an Indiana lake; his account was disputed by an attorney for the accused.

persons.name: David Hennessy
persons.context: Attorney for two people accused in the Indiana lake assault, claiming his clients were victims of a 'smear campaign' and that Booker was the instigator.

persons.name: Daniel Lewis Lee
persons.role: Convicted killer, federal death row inmate
persons.context: His scheduled federal execution was blocked by a judge, leading to a Supreme Court ruling that later allowed it to proceed.

persons.name: Tanya Chutkan
persons.context: Issued an injunction blocking federal executions, citing concerns about the lethal injection protocol.

persons.name: Amy Berman Jackson
persons.context: Presided over Roger Stone's trial and demanded more details on Trump's commutation of Stone's sentence.

persons.name: Lori Loughlin
persons.role: Actress, defendant in college admissions case
persons.context: Sought a reduced bond with her husband after pleading guilty in the college admissions scandal.

persons.name: Mossimo Giannulli
persons.role: Fashion designer, defendant in college admissions case
persons.context: Sought a reduced bond with his wife after pleading guilty in the college admissions scandal.

persons.name: Andrzej Duda
persons.context: Congratulated by President Trump on his reelection victory.

persons.name: Mary Trump
persons.context: A judge ruled she could speak about her family while promoting her book about President Trump.

persons.name: Cyrus Vance Jr.
persons.context: Noted as having won a Supreme Court case to obtain Trump's tax returns but facing political challengers.

persons.name: Seema Verma
persons.context: Stressed the need to follow coronavirus recommendations like wearing masks.

persons.name: Larry Kudlow
persons.context: Stated Trump was willing to consider additional aid to help reopen schools.

persons.name: Mick Mulvaney
persons.role: Former Acting White House Chief of Staff
persons.context: Criticized U.S. coronavirus testing delays, calling them 'inexcusable'.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Directed federal agents to assist in the investigation of a Kansas child's shooting death.

persons.name: Mike Kehoe
persons.context: Linked to a Missouri ambulance purchase deal that the FBI was reportedly probing.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's alleged co-conspirator, former girlfriend, and confidant who helped recruit, groom, and abuse minors for him.
Trump commuted Stone's prison sentence; Stone claimed prosecutors offered him leniency for information implicating Trump.
Trump claimed a 'very good' relationship with Fauci despite reported White House efforts to discredit him over coronavirus response disagreements.
Weissmann was a top prosecutor on Mueller's special counsel team investigating Russian interference.
Married couple who pleaded guilty together in the college admissions scandal and jointly sought a reduced bond.
Hennessy is the defense attorney for individuals accused of assaulting Booker, claiming Booker's narrative is false.
McEnany criticized Ocasio-Cortez's comments linking poverty to violent crime.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at a remote property in New Hampshire. Prosecutors say she tried to flee to another room, and agents found a cell phone wrapped in tinfoil.

events.title: Prosecutors Detail Maxwell's Arrest in Court Filing
events.description: Federal prosecutors filed a court document revealing new details of Maxwell's arrest and arguing she is an extreme flight risk, opposing her release on bail.

events.title: Commutation of Roger Stone's Sentence
events.description: President Trump commuted the prison sentence of his longtime ally Roger Stone, who was convicted of crimes related to the Mueller investigation.

events.title: Supreme Court Allows Federal Execution to Proceed
events.description: The Supreme Court, in a 5-4 vote, cleared the way for the federal execution of Daniel Lewis Lee after a lower court had blocked it.

events.title: Washington NFL Team Retires Name and Logo
events.description: The Washington NFL team announced it would retire its name and logo, widely viewed as a racist slur against Native Americans.

events.title: Alleged Assault of Vauhxx Booker
events.description: Vauhxx Booker reported being assaulted, pinned against a tree, and threatened with a noose by a group of white men at Monroe Lake in Indiana.

events.title: U.S. Rejects China's South China Sea Claims
events.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced the U.S. rejection of most of Beijing's maritime claims in the South China Sea, aligning U.S. policy with a 2016 international tribunal ruling.

keyFacts: During Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, FBI agents found a cell phone wrapped in tinfoil, which prosecutors interpreted as an attempt to evade law enforcement detection.
Prosecutors argued Maxwell is an extreme flight risk with three passports, multiple foreign bank accounts, and access to millions of dollars, including a $4 million Swiss trust.
President Trump commuted the prison sentence of Roger Stone, who claimed Mueller investigators offered him leniency for false testimony against Trump.
The U.S. formally rejected most of China's maritime claims in the South China Sea, supporting a 2016 international tribunal ruling against China.
A federal judge blocked scheduled federal executions, citing concerns about the lethal injection protocol, but the Supreme Court later allowed the execution of Daniel Lewis Lee to proceed.
